title: Pattern-Based Visual Design Workshop for Utilizing Collaborative Learning Design Tools

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational educational theory and experience in designing science curricula
context.additional_context: Educates pre-service and in-service teachers on the use of collaborative learning design tools through a project-based approach, with a focus on visual design strategies applicable in limited technological environments (primarily smartphones)

learning_goals: Learners can independently produce three or more science-integrated scenarios using pattern-based visual tools for collaborative learning activity design.
Understand the fundamental principles of IMS Learning Design (LD) and convert them into visual representations to explain to fellow teachers
Implement a collaborative learning design prototype using smartphone-based tools in a limited technological environment and incorporate feedback

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
